text: Pié Masumbuko (born 29 September 1931) is a Burundian retired politician and physician. He was a member of the Union for National Progress. He was the acting Prime Minister of Burundi from 15 January 1965 to 26 January 1965. He represented Burundi in signing the Partial Test Ban Treaty on October 4, 1963.United States Department of State. United States Treaties and Other International Agreements, Volume 14, Part 2. United States Government Printing Office: Washington, D.C., 1964. title: Pié Masumbuko
